member.name: T:AForge.Imaging.Filters.FilterAnyToAny
member.summary: Base class for filtering any images without changing pixel format
member.remarks: The abstract class is the base class for all filters, which can be applied to color and grayscale images without changing their pixel format and image dimension. The base class is used for filters, which can be applied as directly to the specified image modifying it, as to the specified image returning new image, which represent result of image processing filter.

member.param: Source image to apply filter to
member.returns: Returns filter's result obtained by applying the filter to the source image
member.remarks: The method keeps the source image unchanged and returns the the result of image processing filter as new image.

member.param: Source image to apply filter to

member.remarks: The filter accepts birmap data as input and returns the result of image processing filter as new image. The source image data are kept unchanged.

member.name: T:AForge.Imaging.Filters.Sepia
member.remarks:
The filter makes an image look like an old brown photo. The main idea of the algorithm:
transform to YIQ color space;
modify it;
transform back to RGB.
1) RGB -> YIQ:
Y = 0.299 * R + 0.587 * G + 0.114 * B I = 0.596 * R - 0.274 * G - 0.322 * B Q = 0.212 * R - 0.523 * G + 0.311 * B
2) update:
I = 51 Q = 0
3) YIQ -> RGB:
R = 1.0 * Y + 0.956 * I + 0.621 * Q G = 1.0 * Y - 0.272 * I - 0.647 * Q B = 1.0 * Y - 1.105 * I + 1.702 * Q
Below is the example of this filter application:
Source image
Result image

member.name: T:AForge.Imaging.Image
member.remarks: All methods of this class are static and represent general routines used by different image processing classes.

member.name: M:AForge.Imaging.Image.IsGrayscale(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Check if the image is grayscale
member.returns: Returns true if the image is grayscale or false otherwise.
member.remarks: The methods check if the image is a grayscale image of 256 gradients. The method first examines if the image's pixel format is Format8bppIndexed and then it examines its palette to check if the image is grayscale or not.

member.name: M:AForge.Imaging.Image.CreateGrayscaleImage(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.returns: Returns the created grayscale image
member.remarks: The methods create new grayscale image and initializes its palette. Grayscale image is represented as Format8bppIndexed image with palette initialized to 256 gradients of gray color

member.name: M:AForge.Imaging.Image.SetGrayscalePalette(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Set pallete of the image to grayscale
member.remarks: The method initializes palette of Format8bppIndexed image with 256 gradients of gray color.

member.name: M:AForge.Imaging.Image.Clone(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat)
member.returns: Returns clone of the source image with specified pixel format
member.remarks: The original Bitmap.Clone() does not produce the desired result - it does not create a clone with specified pixel format. More of it, the original method does not create an actual clone - it does not create a copy of the image. That is why this method was implemented to provide the functionality.

member.name: M:AForge.Imaging.Image.Clone(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.returns: Return clone of the source image
member.remarks: The original Bitmap.Clone() does not produce the desired result - it does not create an actual clone (it does not create a copy of the image). That is why this method was implemented to provide the functionality.

member.name: M:AForge.Imaging.Image.FormatImage(System.Drawing.Bitmap@)
member.remarks: Formats the image to one of the formats, which are supported by the AForge.Imaging library. The image is left untouched in the case if it already of Format24bppRgb format or it is grayscale (), otherwise the image converted to Format24bppRgb format.
